page.title: 02Farming in New Thundersley
page.content: The rural parts are almost entirely mixed arable {farming.}The only animals are on{small holdings}and are horses and donkeys out to pasture or free range chickens. There are some riding stables. The {crops}grown are mainly hay and cereals. There is a small amount of {"pick-your-own"}crops e.g. strawberries. There are some small holdings along the main and minor roads, which tend to be rough pasture for horses, fresh vegetables and eggs etc., or non-farming use. There are five large farms in the area but their land has been cut through by major roads, a railway, and the National Grid transmission lines so there are some areas which are scrub and uncultivated land. There are two small areas of woodland.
